author: agusx1211
content: Hey guys! I'm one of the guys who founded Pine finance. I'm afk right now but happy to help is pine is being a roadblock here

author: agusx1211
content: If our frontend works correctly we should user the same vault for two different orders, even if the orders are identical we also use a salt, so the vaults are different

author: agusx1211
content: I can do a deeper analysis later this week tho, btw kudos to Evan for calling this to my attention

author: agusx1211
content: Maybe is better to think of selfdestruct as a kill switch for a contract that can only be used once? So instead of not doing nothing it marks the contract as disabled/removed, and no other contracts can be deployed on that address?

author: albusdompeldorius
content: Hi, are you saying that the vaults have different addresses when using the front-end? I discovered quite a few redeployed vaults deployed by pinecore; at the time of the analysis ~10% of the deployed vaults were redeployments. Were these vaults created manually without using the front-end?

author: albusdompeldorius
content: I'm not certain that this would solve this specific problem. If we neuter selfdestruct, funds sent to a used vault can be stolen by anyone, but if we make selfdestruct mark the contract as disabled, funds sent to a used vault would be locked instead.

author: agusx1211
content: Are those redeployments real or just a failed deploy (reverted) followed by a real one?
